#G13# As a moderator, I want to change my account details, so that I can keep my account details up-to-date.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to delete my account, so that account information and games are no longer stored.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to see dates and times in my local timezone, so that I don't have to do timezone conversion myself.
#G13# As a moderator, I want to get a password reminder by email, so that I can get back to using the application when I've forgotten my password.
Action: Get A Password Reminder By Email

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to select whether to have the team estimate with {0, 1/2, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, etc.} or {0, 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, etc.}, so that the team can use either the modified Fibonacci sequence or powers of 2.
Action: Select The Team Estimate With 0 Etc

Text: #G13# As a moderator, I want to invite up to 15 estimators, so that we can play with large but not immense teams.
#G13# As an estimator, I want to join a game by entering my name on the page I received the URL for, so that I can participate.
Action: Join A Game Entering Name On The Page

Text: #G13# As an estimator, I want to see the item we're estimating, so that I know what I'm giving an estimate for.
#G13# As an estimator, I want to see all items we will try to estimate this session, so that I have a feel for the sizes of the various items.
#G13# As a participant, I want to immediately see that an estimate has been given by a specific estimator, so that I know who has already given an estimate and who we're still waiting for.

#G13# As a participant, I want to be shown all estimates at the same time after all estimators have given their estimate, so that I can be sure estimates are independent and not influenced by other estimates given in the same draw.
Action: Shown All Estimates At The Same Time

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to be able to change my estimate up until the last person selects a card and all are shown, so that I can change my mind based on information I hear.
#G13# As a participant, I want to be able to see each estimator's prior estimates for the story being estimated, so that I can see how his or her opinion has changed so I can ask questions.
Action: See Each Estimator's Prior Estimates The Story Estimated

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to see who gave what estimates during the current round, so that I know this when we're discussing the estimates.

#G13# As a participant, I want to be able start a two-minute countdown timer that all participants can see, so that I can limit the time spent discussing the estimates when I think we've talked long enough.
Action: Start A Minute Countdown Timer That All Participants See

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to have the two-minute timer reset itself as soon as we all play an estimate, so that it's ready for use on the next round.
Action: The Timer Soon As Reset Itself All Play
The Minute Timer Soon As Reset Play An Estimate

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to scroll back through the stories and estimates from prior rounds, so that I can use this information when I estimate the item of the current round.
Action: Scroll Through The Stories From Prior Rounds

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to always have the cards in the same order across multiple draws, so that it's easy to compare estimates.
Action: Have The Cards In The Same Order Across Multiple Draws

Text: #G13# As a participant, I want to have a small thumbnail photo displayed near where my cards are played, so that the game is more personal because I see who I'm estimating with.
Action: Have A Small Thumbnail Photo Cards Where Played

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have written a site which is compliant with XHTML and CSS standards, so that as many people as possible can access the site and view it as intended.
Action: Written A Site Is Compliant With Css Standard
Written A Site Is Compliant With Xhtml

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have a list of definitions for commonly used terms, so that everyone working on the project can understand each other more easily.
Action: Have A List Of Definitions For Commonly Used Terms

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have created database indexes, so that the queries run as fast as possible.

#G13# As a developer, I want to have the application function correctly in Internet Explorer 6 and 7, Firefox 1.5 and 2, and Safari 2, so that as many people as possible can fully use the application.
Action: Have The Application Function In Internet Explorer 2 1.5

Text: #G13# As a developer, I want to have the site comply with the W3C accessibility guidelines where possible, so that people with accessibility issues can use the application.
#G13# As a user, I want to have the application respond quickly to my actions, so that I don't get bored.
#G13# As a user, I want to be able to use Unicode, so that I can use any language I like.
#G13# As a user, I want to see sensible and predictable URLs, so that the application feels logical and transparent.
#G13# As a user, I want to have nice error pages when something goes wrong, so that I can trust the system and its developers.

#G13# As a Researcher, I want results to be stored in a non-identifiable way, so that I can study the data to see things like whether estimates converged around the first opinion given by "estimator A" for example.
#G13# As a Mike, I want to be able to see some metrics on use of the game, so that I can see how much it is being used.
Action: See Some Metrics On Use Of The Game

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to publish a dataset, so that I can view just the dataset with a few people.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to publish a dataset, so that I can share the dataset publicly with everyone.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to sign up for an account, so that that I can publish my data package to the registry and to have a publisher account to publish my data package under.
#G14# As a Visitor, I want to sign up via github or google, so that that I don't have to enter lots of information and remember my password for yet another website.
#G14# As an Admin, I want to invite someone to join the platform, so that that they can start contributing or using data.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to import my data package into the registry, so that my data has a permanent online home to access.
Action: Import Data Package Into The Registry

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to configure my client, so that I can start publishing data packages.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to use a publish command to update a data package that is already in the registry, so that it appears there.
Action: Update A Data Package Already Is In The Registry

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to unpublish a data package, so that it is no longer visible to anyone.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to permanently delete a data package, so that that it no longer takes up storage space.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to validate the data I am about to publish to the registry, so that that I publish good data and know that I am doing.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to know that the data I am downloading is good and can be relied on, so that that I don't have to check it myself or run into annoying bugs later on.

#G14# As a Publisher, I want to publish a data package where its resource data is stored on my servers but the registry caches a copy of that data, so that that if my data is lost or gets broken I still have a copy people can use.
Action: Publish A Data Package Resource Data Where Stored On Servers

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to be able to get the data for a data package even if the original data has been moved or removed, so that that I can still use is and my app or analysis keeps working.
Action: Get The Data For A Data Package

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to publish a data package in the UI, so that that it is available and published.
Action: Publish A Data Package In The Ui

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to create a data package in the UI so that it is available and published.
Action: Create A Data Package In The Ui

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to be able to restore the deleted data package via cli, so that that it is back visible and available to view, download.
Action: Restore The Deleted Data Package Via Cli

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to undelete the deleted data packages, so that that the deleted data packages is now visible again.

#G14# As a Publisher, I want to be able to preview the views of the current data package using cli prior to publishing, so that that I can refine the json declarations of datapackage view section to achieve a great looking result.
Action: Preview The Views Of The Current Data Package Prior Using Cli To Publishing

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to view a data package online, so that I can get a sense of whether this is the dataset I want.
#G14# As a publisher, I want to show the world how my published data is, so that that it immediately catches consumer's attention.
#G14# As a consumer, I want to view the data package, so that that I can get a sense of whether I want this dataset or not.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to preview a datapackage I have prepared, so that that I can check it works and share the results.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to see how much the data has been downloaded, so that that I can choose most popular in the case when there are several alternatives for my use case.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to see real examples of published packages so that I can understand how useful and simple the datapackage format and the registry is.
Action: See Real Examples Of Published Packages

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to see some example data packages quickly, so that I get a sense of what is on this site and if it is useful to look further.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to search data packages, so that that I can find the ones I want.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to search based on description of data package, so that that I can find package which related to some key words.
Action: Search On Description Of Data Package

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to download the data package in one file, so that that I don't have to download descriptor and each resource by hand.
Action: Download The Data Package In File

Text: #G14# As a Developer, I want to use data package as a node lib in my project, so that that I can depend on it using my normal dependency framework.
Action: Use Data Package As A Node Lib In Project

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to load a Data Package from R, so that that I can immediately start playing with it.
Action: Load A Data Package From R

Text: #G14# As a Data Analyst I want to download a data package, so that that I can study it and wrangle with it to infer new data or generate new insights.
#G14# As a Data Analyst, I want to update previously downloaded data package, so that that I can work with the most recent data.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to download a DataPackage's data one coherent SQLite database, so that that I can get it easily in one form.
Action: Download A Datapackage's Data Coherent Sqlite Database

Text: #G14# As a Data Analyst, I want to compare different versions of some datapackage locally, so that that I can see schema changes clearly and adjust my analytics code to the desired schema version.
Action: Compare Different Versions Of Some Datapackage

Text: #G14# As a Web Developer, I want to be able to install multiple versions of the same datapackage separately, so that that all my projects could be developed independently and deployed locally.
Action: Install Multiple Versions Of The Same Datapackage

Text: #G14# As a Developer, I want to list all DataPackages requirements for my project in the file and pin the exact versions of any DataPackage that my project depends on, so that that the project can be deterministically deployed locally and won't break because of the DataPackage schema changes.
Action: List All Datapackages Requirements For Project In The File
Pin The Exact Versions Of Any Datapackage

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to tag datapackage to create a snapshot of data on the registry server, so that that consumers can refer to it.
Action: Create A Snapshot Of Data On The Registry Server

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to be warned that a tag exists when I try to overwrite it, so that that I don't accidentally overwrite stable tagged data which is relied on by consumers.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to be able to overwrite the previously tagged datapackage, so that that I can fix it if I mess up.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to version my Data Package and keep multiple versions around including older versions, so that that I do not break consumer systems when I change my datapackage.
Action: Keep Multiple Versions Including Older Versions

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to be able to get access to a previous version I tagged, so that that I can return to it and review it.
Action: Get Access To A Previous Version

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to know full details of how the data package schema has changed, so that that I can adjust my scripts to handle it.
Action: Know Full Details The Data Package Schema How Has Changed

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to get a sense of the age of the datapackage that I have downloaded before, so that that I can decide if I should update or not.
Action: Get A Sense Of The Age Of The Datapackage

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to view a Datapackage at a particular version online, so that that I can present/discuss the particular data timeslice of interest with other people.
Action: View A Datapackage At A Online Particular Version

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to download a Data package at a particular version, so that that I know it is compatible with my scripts and system.
Action: Download A Data Package At A Particular Version

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to be notified of changes to a package I care about, so that that I can check out what has changed and take action.
Action: Notified Of Changes To A Package

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to see how active the site is, so that I can decide if I should get involved.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to browse and find publishers, so that that I can find interesting publishers and their packages.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to see a publisher's profile, so that that I can discover their packages and get a sense of how active and good they are.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to view a publisher's profile, so that that I can see who is behind a particular package or to see what other packages they produce.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to search among all data packages owned by a publisher, so that that I can easily find one data package amongst all the data packages by this publisher.
Action: Search Among All Data Packages A Publisher

Text: #G14# As an Owner, I want to edit my profile, so that that it is updated with new information.
#G14# As an Owner, I want to invite an existing user, so that the user can become a member of my publisher.
#G14# As an owner, I want to invite someone using their email to sign up and become a member of my Publisher, so that that they are authorized to publish data packages under my Publisher.
Action: Sign Up A Member Of Publisher

Text: #G14# As an owner, I want to remove someone from membership in my publisher, so that they no longer have ability to publish or modify my data packages.
Action: Remove Someone From Membership In Publisher

Text: #G14# As an owner, I want to view all the people in my organization and what roles they have, so that that I can change these if I want.
#G14# As an owner, I want to make a user an owner, so that they have full control.
#G14# As an owner, I want to remove a user as an owner, so that they are just a member and no longer have full control.
Action: Remove A User As An Owner

Text: #G14# As an Admin, I want to set key configuration parameters for my site deployment, so that that I can change key information like the site title.
Action: Set Key Configuration Parameters For Site Deployment

Text: #G14# As an Admin, I want to see key metrics about usage such as users, API usage, downloads, so that that I know how things are going.
Action: See Key Metrics About Usage Such As Users
See Key Metrics About Usage Such As Api Usage
See Key Metrics About Usage Such As Download

Text: #G14# As an Admin, I want to have a pricing plan and billing system, so that that I can charge users and make my platform sustainable.

#G14# As a Publisher, I want to know if this site has a pricing plan and what the prices are, so that that I can work out what this will cost me in the future and have a sense that these guys are sustainable.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to sign up for a given pricing plan, so that that I am entitled to what it allows.
Action: Sign Up For A Given Pricing Plan

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to have private data packages, so that I can share just with my team.

That should probably be a person contact including name, phone, email, maybe title and address. I should be able to run a report periodically showing the storage consumed by each financial contact.

I want to be able to elect to either replicate remotely or not and possibly to replicate beyond the primary remote site. I would also like to see a summary of this at the collection level on my dashboard.
